section.name: Product Installation for Windows
section.p: The binary Depot installations in zip format require the creation of a DPML installation directory and the unpacking the zip file content into that directory. Please review the following instructions for single or shared installations.

ol.li: create the directory %APPDATA%\DPML (or any other location you prefer)
define an environment variable DPML_HOME referring to that directory
copy or move the contents of the distribution to your DPML_HOME directory
create the directory %PROGRAMFILES%\DPML (or a alternative preferred location)
define an environment variable DPML_SYSTEM referring to that location
copy or move the content of the distribution 'Shared' directory into %DPML_SYSTEM%
create the per-user application data directory %APPDATA%\DPML (or declare the environment variable DPML_HOME to point to an alternative location)
copy or move the distribution 'Data' and 'Preferences' directory, and related txt files to each users DPML_HOME directory

section.p: The following section describes the procedures for defining the DPML_SYSTEM and/or DPML_HOME environment variables and modifying your system path.

subsection.name: Configuring MyComputer
subsection.p: Under Windows select Properties for 'My Computer' to display the system properties panel.

subsection.name: System Setup
subsection.p: Select the 'Advanced Tab' and click on the Environment Variables button.

subsection.name: Environment Variable
subsection.p: From the environment panel select 'New' under the system properties group to open up a dialog box for the creation of the DPML_SYSTEM environment variable.

subsection.name: Create DPML_SYSTEM
subsection.p: Create a new environment variabled named DPML_SYSTEM that declares the location of the root DPML system directory (this is a directory containing the 'local' and 'bin' directories).

subsection.name: Updating you PATH
subsection.p: Edit the PATH environment variable to include the %DPML_SYSTEM%\bin path value. Make sure you separate the value from other entries with the ';' character.

subsection.name: Create the optional DPML_HOME
subsection.p: Transit and other DPML tools will attempt to locate the 'Preferences' and 'Data' directories using %APPDATA%\DPML (which typically translates to 'C:\Documents and Settings\[username]\Application Data\DPML'. If you want to use a different root directory for user data then you need to declare the environment variable DPML_HOME.
